thread.title: Theo Epstein explains why Cubs will turn NLCS around
thread.title_full: Theo Epstein explains why Cubs will turn NLCS around | New York Post

author: Dan Martin
title: Theo Epstein explains why Cubs will turn NLCS around
text:
CHICAGO — The Cubs returned to Wrigley Field on Monday in the NLCS with an unenviable task ahead of them, down 0-2 to the Mets.
But Theo Epstein has been here before and isn’t daunted.
“I think the series is far from over,” the Cubs President of Baseball Operations said Monday before the team worked out in advance of Tuesday’s Game 3. “I’d be shocked if this is how we’re going out. It’s not representative of the talent and character we have in this clubhouse. I think we’ll show a lot better baseball over course of this series. They’re still really confident, as am I.”
Epstein knows better than most how to overcome a big playoff deficit. Epstein was the general manager of the Red Sox team that stormed back from a 3-0 deficit against the Yankees in the 2004 ALCS to get to the World Series, which they won for the first time in 86 years.
“There’s a reason they make these important series long,” Epstein said. “We’ve always responded. All year long, we’ve had a winning streak after a stretch of poor play.”
He is optimistic the warm weather of Chicago and the familiarity of Wrigley will help.
“We plan on playing well at home,” Epstein said. “It was kind of a very forgettable first two games from a number of points. They pitched really well right out of the chute. I think we probably hit more balls hard than they did. Give them credit, but we haven’t really played our game yet. I think that starts [Tuesday]. They’ve got to beat us four times.”
